results.title: Strictly Ballroom
results.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the establishment by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

results.description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the “establishment” by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps and taking on a new ugly-duckling partner who blooms under his tutelage. Ballet dancer Paul Mercurio shot to fame with this film. He is partnered by Tara Morice and supported by Barry Otto, Gia Carides and Bill Hunter.

Ballet dancer Paul Mercurio shot to fame with this film. He is partnered by Tara Morice and supported by Barry Otto, Gia Carides and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Strictement Personnel = Strictly Private
results.brief_description:
Jean Cottard lives in Lyons where he works as a police officer. He occupies his leisure time with writing. Called to Paris by his publisher, Jean uses the opportunity to visit his relatives. To his great surprise, he discovers they are all involved in criminal activities. Little by little, he learns that his father has become an expert forger, his brother is a drug addict while his stepmother is works as a prostitute. Things get worse. Jean’s stepmother is murdered aboard the train that was meant to take him back to Lyons. As Jean investigates the murder, he realises just how personnal this affair is.

Credits: Producers, Simone Benzakien, Pierre Jolivet ; director, Pierre Jolivet ; writer, Pierre Jolivet ; photography, Christian Lamarque ; music, Serge Perathoner.
Cast: Pierre Arditi, Jacques Penot, Caroline Chaniolleau, Jean Reno, Robert Rimbaud, Jean Bouise.

results.brief_description: Spans four regions of the Third World and touches upon major developmental problems in agriculture, health, and social sciences whiich are being tackled by local researchers under the sponsorship of the International Development Research Centre.

results.title: Stretch away stress
results.creator_credit: Samantha Livingstone, Gillian Ross and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: In today’s busy lifestyles, stress plays an unnecessarily large role in people lives. This video attempts to address the problem by presenting two half hour self nurturing sessions. Yoga teacher Dr Gillian Ross will guide the viewer through stretches and yoga postures, meditative pauses, with constant attention to deep breathing and the release of tension. Provide your body with a tonic for the whole body.

results.title: Stress: your own worst enemy
results.creator_credit: Robert S. Fiveson, Fiveson Productions and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: The film examines stress in biological, social and emotional terms and outlines various methods for overcoming its health-threatening effects. Aided by interpretations from stress specialists, the film focuses principally on how different people experience and cope with stress in their daily lives. Several less conventional ways in which people cope with stress are shown: a company recreation project, a community sports program, meditation, yoga, Tai Chi, acupuncture and biofeedback. The film concludes by describing some of the tell-tale signs of stress, and encouraging sufferers to take action.

results.title: Stress: parents with a handicapped child
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens and Derrick Knight and Partners
results.brief_description: Illustrates the difficulties created for parents by mental and physical defects of children. Five children handicapped in different ways are shown in their family situations and their parents discuss their problems.

results.title: Stress: A Personal Challenge (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This vide shows the way stress manifests itself mentally and physically, and presents some of the everyday gestures which may indicate stress. It highlights an individual, personal approach to dealing with stress; and how to control it and be turned to one’s advantage.

results.title: Stress, health and you (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Herbert Long and Neil Mawby Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with stress and its effect on our health. Dr. Selye discusses how stress can have both positive and negative causes. An overview that helps people to analyse how their own health is modified by stressful events.
